sections.1_story: Imagine you are mixing two juices in a certain ratio to get the perfect taste. Understanding ratio and proportion helps you solve problems in recipes, business, and exams.

ğŸ’¡ Continued Proportion: If a/b = b/c, then a, b, c are in continued proportion.
ğŸ’¡ Mean Proportion: If a/x = x/b, then x is the mean proportion between a and b.
ğŸ’¡ Third Proportion: If a:b = b:c, then c is the third proportion to a and b.
ğŸ’¡ Compound Ratio: The product of two or more ratios.
ğŸ’¡ Direct Proportion: Both quantities increase or decrease together.
ğŸ’¡ Inverse Proportion: One quantity increases as the other decreases.
ğŸ’¡ Partitive Proportion: Dividing a quantity into parts in a given ratio.
